# Pull Request

## Description
Brief description of the changes in this PR.

## Type of Change
Please delete options that are not relevant.

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Code refactoring
- [ ] Test improvement

## Related Issues
Fixes #(issue number)
Closes #(issue number)
Related to #(issue number)

## Changes Made
- [ ] List specific changes made
- [ ] Another change
- [ ] Yet another change

## Testing
Describe the tests that you ran to verify your changes.

- [ ] Unit tests pass (`make test`)
- [ ] Integration tests pass
- [ ] Statistical tests pass (if applicable)
- [ ] Performance benchmarks run (if applicable)
- [ ] Manual testing performed

### Test Configuration
- Python version(s): 
- Operating system(s):
- Additional dependencies:

## Code Quality
- [ ] Code follows project style guidelines (`make lint`)
- [ ] Code is formatted with Black (`make format`)
- [ ] Type hints are added/updated (`make type-check`)
- [ ] Docstrings are added/updated for public APIs
- [ ] Pre-commit hooks pass

## Documentation
- [ ] Documentation has been updated (if needed)
- [ ] Examples have been added/updated (if needed)
- [ ] CHANGELOG.md has been updated
- [ ] API documentation is auto-generated correctly

## Security
- [ ] No sensitive information is exposed
- [ ] Dependencies are secure and up-to-date
- [ ] Code follows security best practices

## Performance
- [ ] No significant performance regression
- [ ] Performance improvements are documented
- [ ] Memory usage is reasonable

## Backwards Compatibility
- [ ] Changes are backwards compatible
- [ ] Breaking changes are documented
- [ ] Migration guide provided (if applicable)

## Checklist
- [ ] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING](CONTRIBUTING.md) guidelines
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published

## Screenshots (if applicable)
Add screenshots to help explain your changes.

## Additional Notes
Add any additional notes about the implementation, design decisions, or anything else reviewers should know.

## Reviewer Guidelines
For reviewers, please check:
- [ ] Code quality and style
- [ ] Test coverage and quality
- [ ] Documentation completeness
- [ ] Performance implications
- [ ] Security considerations
- [ ] API design consistency
- [ ] Statistical validity (for randomness-related changes)
